intro: Statice dalmatica, commonly known as Dalmatian lavender, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its spikes of small, showy flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought-resistant nature. Statice dalmatica is often cultivated for ornamental purposes in gardens and is also used in floral arrangements due to its long-lasting blooms.
